creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
JSP Examples in Tomcat 4.0 have a 'Source' button. All but the numberguess example do execute the JSP instead of displaying the source. My patch uses source.jsp to display the sources instead of referencing the *.txt files.

I will repost a patch in the tomcat-dev list, which corrects this behavior for Tomcat 4.0

But the Tomcat 3.2 examples look pretty much the same.

Fixed on Tomcat 3.3.

I will review Tomcat 3.2 too.
creator: nacho@apache.org
stamhankar@hotmail.com
text:
I'm not sure if this is fixed yet (and I'm not planning on hacking Tomcat, so I
don't want to check out the CVS tree), but I found a problem in ShowSource in
3.2.1 that you don't mention: it doesn't work at all because of the "security
fix".  The code says:

       	if ((jspFile.indexOf( ".." ) >= 0) ||
            (jspFile.toUpperCase().indexOf("/WEB-INF/") != 0) ||
            (jspFile.toUpperCase().indexOf("/META-INF/") != 0))
	    throw new JspTagException("Invalid JSP file " + jspFile);

But this will always be true since for good files the indexOf will return -1.  I
think the intention was for those != to be ==.

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
In Tomcat 3.2.3 (probably earlier too) and Tomcat 3.3, the code is now:

    if ((jspFile.indexOf( ".." ) >= 0) ||
       (jspFile.toUpperCase().indexOf("/WEB-INF/") >= 0) ||
       (jspFile.toUpperCase().indexOf("/META-INF/") >= 0))
           throw new JspTagException("Invalid JSP file " + jspFile);

This should fix the problem.
